action.data:
--debug declare @Status Nvarchar(150) --end debug
Exec dbo.USP_LockerFreeDone @LockerBookID,@LockerID,@Parameters_FromDate,@Status OUTPUT
Set @Result_ShowMessage = @Status

businessRules.rule: if @MemberID is null begin /* prevent the default action processing */ set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_Focus = 'MemberID,Required field.' end

if @LockerID is null begin /* prevent the default action processing */ set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_Focus = 'LockerID,Required field.' end

if @BookStart is null begin /* prevent the default action processing */ set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_Focus = 'BookStart,Required field.' end
if Exists(select LockerID From dbo.LockerBooking Where LockerID = @LockerID And BookStatus = @BookStatus) begin /* prevent the default action processing */ set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_ShowMessage = 'Duplicate Booking Found.' end
Update dbo.Locker Set IsFree = 0 where LockerID=@LockerID

--debug declare @Status Nvarchar(150) --end debug
Exec dbo.USP_LockerFreeDone @LockerBookID,@LockerID,@Parameters_FromDate,@Status OUTPUT
Set @Result_ShowMessage = @Status

action.confirmation: Do you confirmed Annual Date Range?
Do you confirmed Annual Date Range?

businessRules.rule:
Declare @MemberAnnualDup int
Select @MemberAnnualDup = Count(MemberID) From MemberAnnualBillDetail Where MemberID = @MemberID And Year(AnnualFrDate) = Year(@AnnualFrDate)
Set @MemberAnnualDup = IsNull(@MemberAnnualDup,0)
if (@MemberAnnualDup >= 1) begin /* prevent the default action processing */ set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_ShowMessage = 'Duplicate Annual Date Found.' end

if @AnnualFrDate is null begin /* prevent the default action processing */ set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_Focus = 'AnnualFrDate,Required field.' end

businessRules.rule:
Set @CreatedBy = @BusinessRules_Username Set @IsCardActive = 1
Declare @Dupl int set @Dupl = 0 if exists( SELECT [MemberCardID] FROM [dbo].[MemberCard] where MemberID=@MemberID ) begin Set @Dupl = 1 end if (@Dupl>0) begin set @CardNumber = '' set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_Focus = 'CardNumber,Duplicate Member Card Register.' end

businessRules.rule:
if (@MemberOfType is null) set @MemberOfType = 'Full Member'
Declare @Dup int set @Dup = 0 Select @Dup = Count(MemberID) From dbo.MemberInfo where MemberCode=@MemberCode
if (@Dup>0) begin /* prevent the default action processing */ set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_ShowMessage = 'Duplicate Member Code.' end

if @CellPhone is null begin /* prevent the default action processing */ set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_Focus = 'CellPhone,Required field.' end

if @Email is null begin /* prevent the default action processing */ set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 /* set the focus on the field and display an error */ set @Result_Focus = 'Email,Required field.' end

-- debug Declare @Session_ParentMemberID int -- end debug
Set @Session_ParentMemberID @MemberID

view.label: ^SignUpViewLabel^Account Sign Up^SignUpViewLabel^
view.headerText: ^SignUpViewHeaderText^Please fill this form and click OK button to sign up for an account. Click Cancel to return to the previous screen.^SignUpViewHeaderText^

category.description: ^SignUpViewNewUserInfoCategoryDescription^Please enter user name and password. Note that password must be at least 7 characters long and include one non-alphanumeric character. Only approved users will be able to login into the website.^SignUpViewNewUserInfoCategoryDescription^

^SignUpViewPasswordRecoveryCategoryDescription^These fields are required to help you to recover a forgotten password. During the recovery process you will be asked to enter a user name. If a user account exists then a security question is requested to be answered. A correct answer will trigger an email with a temporary password send to the registered email.^SignUpViewPasswordRecoveryCategoryDescription^

view.label: ^PasswordRequestViewLabel^Password Recovery: Step 1 of 2^PasswordRequestViewLabel^
view.headerText: ^PasswordRequestViewHeaderText^Please fill this form and click Continue button to recover the forgotten password. Click Cancel to return to the previous screen.^PasswordRequestViewHeaderText^

view.label: ^IdentityConfirmViewLabel^Password Recovery: Step 2 of 2^IdentityConfirmViewLabel^
view.headerText: ^IdentityConfirmViewHeaderText^Please fill this form and click Submit button to recover the forgotten password. Click Cancel to return to the previous screen.^IdentityConfirmViewHeaderText^

category.description:
^IdentityConfirmationViewIdentityConfirmCategoryDescription^Answer the following question to receive your password.


^IdentityConfirmationViewIdentityConfirmCategoryDescription^

view.label: ^MyAccountViewLabel^My Account^MyAccountViewLabel^
view.headerText: ^MyAccountViewHeaderText^Please review your membership information below. Click Update My Account to change this record, or click Cancel to return back.^MyAccountViewHeaderText^

category.description: ^MyAccountViewCurrentPasswordCategoryDescription^Please enter your current password to create new password, update your email address, or change password recovery question and answer.^MyAccountViewCurrentPasswordCategoryDescription^

^MyAccountViewNewPasswordCategoryDescription^Please enter new password. Note that password must be at least 7 characters long and include one non-alphanumeric character.^MyAccountViewNewPasswordCategoryDescription^

^MyAccountViewPasswordRecoveryCategoryDescription^During the recovery of a forgotten password you will be asked to enter your user name. If a user account exists then a password question must be answered. A correct answer will trigger an email with a temporary password send to you.^MyAccountViewPasswordRecoveryCategoryDescription^

businessRules.rule:
if (@MemberOfType is null) set @MemberOfType = 'Children Of Member'
Declare @NoOfChildExists int, @MaxCildCount int set @NoOfChildExists = 0 SELECT @NoOfChildExists = Count(MemberID) FROM [dbo].[Memberinfo] where [ParentMemberID] = @ParentMemberID And MemberOfType = 'Children Of Member'
Set @NoOfChildExists = IsNull(@NoOfChildExists,1)
if (@MemberCode is not null) Set @MemberCode = @MemberCode + 'C1'
select @MaxCildCount=MaxChildCount from dbo.MemberCategory where MemberCategoryID=@MemberCategoryID
if (@NoOfChildExists = @MaxCildCount) begin set @BusinessRules_PreventDefault = 1 set @Result_ShowMessage = 'No of Children Exit the Limit.' end

-- assign a filter if the client-side data view is not tagged if @BusinessRules_Tags is null begin
-- tag the data view set @BusinessRules_Tags = 'Filtered' -- assign a filter range to Order Date set @ParentMemberID_Filter_Equal = @Session_ParentMemberID -- let the user know that the "soft" filter has been applied ---set @Result_ShowViewMessage = 'A "soft" filter has been applied.' end
